number of helpful: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6
												Playing goalunited for several years now, and goalunited PRO is my favourite version so far. This game is what every football fan wants to have when he is at home or on the go. (yes, it's also supported at iOS and Android too).Game is complex and makes you think about everything about your football clubs. Taking care of squad, training, building best possible stadium complex, finding new youth talents, hiring best staff and so on, basically you are involved in every single bit of your football club and your decisions that you make is what matters.One more good thing about goalunited PRO is that the game is constantly getting new updates.If you are looking for a long term fun in the multiplayer football manager game, goalunited PRO is for you.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10
												I started playing goalunited a few years ago, and I would play for a few weeks then stop, then start again.Now I just can't help but play every few days. Since the update to goalunited PRO, the game has become one that keen football managers can become addicted to. Managing your training sessions, developing your youth squad and most importantly, making sure your team succeeds leads to a fulfilling journey with your players in the team. The game itself is basic, but I'm sure the coding behind it is complex. There may be some times where strong teams get run over by newly led clubs, but that's an issue that will hopefully be patched. Also, the merchandising system is a bit weak - it needs more attention and perhaps a new system completely. Perhaps the worst part of this game is the matchmaking - and even then it's not too bad. When I ask for a 1on1 match, my team is put with teams far stronger than I am - even when I select equal team strength. It's fine, when you are only playing a friendly. But during cup matches and International Masters it becomes a bit more infuriating.Overall, seeing this game taking the leap from web-browser to steam is inspiring. From such a small game, it has evolved into an international managing career. Hopefully most will share the same opinion as me when you jump onto this mesmerising football managing game.
